results.headline: When Being a Yogi Had an Exotic Air
results.summary_short: “Awake: The Life of Yogananda” tells the story of an Indian yogi who garnered relatively wide attention in the first half of the 20th century.

results.headline: Maybe the Robots Don’t Like Protocol
results.summary_short: In “Autómata,” an investigator in a shrinking world looks into the death of a dog killed by a robot.

results.headline: Windswept Kisses and a Drop of Blood
results.summary_short: Mathieu Amalric’s film version of Georges Simenon’s “The Blue Room” deals with adultery, crime and the relationship of sights and sounds.

results.headline: A Rare Musical Mentorship, Captured With Heart and Soul
results.summary_short: “Keep On Keepin’ On” is Alan Hicks’s affectionate and moving look at the relationship between the great trumpeter Clark Terry and the jazz pianist Justin Kauflin.

results.headline: Making Themselves at Home
results.summary_short: After fleeing war in Africa, refugees in the American heartland get help from Reese Witherspoon’s character in “The Good Lie.”

results.headline: Shakespearean Revenge in a Violent Kashmir
results.summary_short: A mother’s loyalties and mystery carries the movie “Haider,” a version of “Hamlet.”

results.headline: Nigeria: One Family’s Bittersweet Reflection
results.summary_short: “The Supreme Price,” directed by Joanna Lipper, depicts Nigeria’s Abiola family as all-too-human leaders of a democracy movement.
